snippet: Ekaterina Makarova and Elena Vesnina of Russia, the fourth seeds, won their second Grand Slam doubles title, ending Martina Hingis’s run at the United States Open with a 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 victory over Hingis and Flavia Pennetta on Saturday night.
abstract: Ekaterina Makarova and Elena Vesnina of Russia, fourth seeds, win their second Grand Slam doubles title, ending Martina Hingis’s run at the United States Open with a victory over Hingis and Flavia Pennetta; other tennis news noted.
lead_paragraph: Ekaterina Makarova and Elena Vesnina of Russia, the fourth seeds, won their second Grand Slam doubles title, ending Martina Hingis’s run at the United States Open with a 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 victory over Hingis and Flavia Pennetta on Saturday night.

headline.main: Russians Win in Doubles at U.S. Open
